results.title: Island observed
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly, ONF | NFB and Hector Lemieux
results.brief_description: A film record of M.E.T.E.I. (Medical Expedition to Easter Island), one of the most unusual scientific enquiries ever launched, headed by a McGill University research team. While the film is concerned mainly with the physical condition of Easter Islanders, it also provides glimpses of island activities, a village wedding, and the famous long-faced stone sculptures.

results.title: Island link
results.brief_description: In March of 1957, the cable linking Tasmania with the mainland was broken. This film shows the operations necessary to locate the break and raise, repair and re-lay the submarine cable in Bass Strait.
results.description: In March of 1957, the cable linking Tasmania with the mainland was broken. This film shows the operations necessary to locate the break and raise, repair and re-lay the submarine cable in Bass Strait.

results.title: Island fuse
results.brief_description: An experimental film in which the filmmakers are concerned with the experience of filming: the interaction between projected image, screen, camera, projector, light and filters. Old b&w documentary footage was reworked in colour, by refilming from a rear projector screen.
results.description: An experimental film in which the filmmakers are concerned with the experience of filming: the interaction between projected image, screen, camera, projector, light and filters. Old b&w documentary footage was reworked in colour, by refilming from a rear projector screen.

results.title: Island exile
results.brief_description: When a Nobel Peace Prize was awarded to the United Nations High Commission for Refugees the money was used to rehabilitate refugees in Greece, many of whom were skilled workers living a life of inactivity, misery and despair. With the arrival of a UN social worker, life for the refugees took on a new meaning. But, in many countries, the struggle for better conditions still goes on.

results.title: Island at the edge
results.creator_credit: Films Incorporated, Michael Gottlieb and Ron Blau
results.brief_description: A documentary of the annual slaughter of dolphins which takes place on Iki Island, Japan, by fishermen who are trying to protect their livelihood.

results.title: Island
results.brief_description: From a description of what it is like for black prisoners in the South African gaol ‘The Island’, the unreasonableness of apartheid is shown. It was also here that Nelson Mandela was held captive for many years. The film examines the role of language (as an expression of the penal code, social convention, metaphysics) in political repression and challenges the viewer with an unconventional combination of first-person oral history accounts, music, still images and computer graphics.

results.title: Island
results.brief_description: An early Paul Cox experimental short film, this work strives to be a film poem. This talented and now renowned Australian filmmaker has presented impressions of a Greek island at war.

results.title: Islam: the faith and the people
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Religions of the world”.
Islam is the world’s fastest growing religion and embraced by one out of every five people on earth. The program looks at the Islamic faith in comtemporary society as well as it’s history and the Prophet Mohammed. Also featured is a discussion of art and science in the Islamic faith.
